stories.headline: Rubio cancels Ukraine talks but holds constructive Greenland meeting
stories.summary: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has cancelled planned talks with Ukraine at the Munich Security Conference, while meetings on Greenland were described as constructive. The shift signals changing diplomatic priorities in the Trump administration.

stories.headline: Swedish Migration Minister: teenagers must complete high school
stories.summary: Sweden's Minister of Migration has announced that teenagers should be permitted to finish their secondary education, indicating a potential policy shift affecting young asylum seekers and migrants in the education system.

stories.headline: Sweden Democrats reach agreement on residence permits
stories.summary: Leadership of the Sweden Democrats has announced broad agreement on residence permit policies, positioning the party to shape immigration regulations under the current coalition government.

stories.headline: Zelenskyy proposes two-month ceasefire followed by elections
stories.summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has proposed a two-month ceasefire to be followed by elections, whilst seeking at least twenty years of security guarantees from Western powers. Fresh peace talks between Ukraine and Russia are scheduled for next week.

stories.headline: AI Sweden recognised as societal actor of the year
stories.summary: Sweden's AI organisation has been honoured as societal actor of the year and has strengthened Canadian ties during high-level business visits. The announcement comes as Swedish municipalities expand AI usage and new procurement guidelines support civil society adoption.

stories.headline: 250,000 Iranians protest regime in Munich
stories.summary: Up to 250,000 Iranian dissidents gathered in Munich for massive protests against Tehran's government. Reza Pahlavi, son of the deposed shah, declared his readiness to lead a movement for regime change.

stories.headline: Salem march attracts record-low attendance
stories.summary: The Salem march, traditionally associated with extremist movements, attracted fewer participants than ever before. Meanwhile, multiple individuals have been sentenced for incitement and harassment related to political disruptions and Pride events.

stories.headline: Swedish-American astronaut reaches International Space Station
stories.summary: Astronaut Kayla Meir and the Crew-12 expedition have successfully reached the International Space Station, marking a milestone for Swedish participation in orbital missions.
